snippet: With temperatures cresting at 115 degrees last week, Hill City has earned a new distinction as the center of America’s summer inferno.
abstract: Hill City, Kan, has endured the worst of a brutal national heat wave, with temperatures as high as 115 degrees persisting for five consecutive days; heat has lead to wilted crops, failed air conditioners and a series of destructive thunderstorms.
lead_paragraph: With temperatures cresting at 115 degrees last week, Hill City has earned a new distinction as the center of America’s summer inferno.

headline.seo: Kansas Town Struggles to Deal With 115 Degrees
headline.main: In One Kansas Town, Even Hotter Than Usual
headline.print_headline: For One Kansas Town, Even Hotter Than Usual
